item.title: Alberto
item.description: One in a Million, OIAM, The Friend

item.title: Claram
item.description: Clara and her friend, who are the only members of the Church in their school in Denmark, became missionaries by sharing the Book of Mormon with their teacher.

item.title: Erika
item.description: Erika celebrated the new San Salvador El Salvador Temple by learning how to do family history indexing and bringing the blessings of the gospel to hundreds of Salvadoran ancestors.

item.title: Jonatan
item.description: A special gift from a neighbor gave Jonatan from Sweden the opportunity to serve in return.

item.title: Kuulani
item.description: Kuulani from Tahiti shows her love for Heavenly Father by sharing her musical talents to bless others in her ward.

item.title: Samuel
item.description: Samuel of the Philippines tells how his family started saving money for his mission even before he was born.

item.title: Pascal
item.description: Pascal of Australia tenderly remembers her baptism day and the important part her family played.

item.title: Sandra
item.description: Sandra from Ghana prayed that her mother would come home safely during a bad rainstorm.

item.title: Arina
item.description: Arina of Russia tells about an experience she had with prayer and feeling the gentle comfort of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Emeri
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson’s examples of service inspired Emeri and her family to serve others.

item.title: Hailey
item.description: Hailey from Washington magnifies her talents by giving talks and playing the piano in her small branch and by being an example to her friends.

item.title: Brennon
item.description: Brennon looks forward to earning his Faith in God award and doing baptisms for the dead in the Johannesburg South Africa Temple.

item.title: Tyler
item.description: Three simple prayers helped Tyler from California reunite a timid fawn with its mother.

item.title: Josie
item.description: Nephi’s obedience inspired Josie from Canada to improve her reading skills.

item.title: Siri
item.description: Siri from Norway tells about seeing President Monson in person when she visited Salt Lake City during general conference.

item.title: Lillie
item.description: Lillie from Hawaii created the “aloha spirit” of love and friendship by sharing the Book of Mormon with doctors who treated her cancer.

item.title: This Grand Opportunity: Elizabeth McCune and the First Sister Missionaries
item.description: Elizabeth McCune helped missionaries in England in 1897 to overcome anti-Mormon rumors about Mormon women. Learn more on history.lds.org

item.title: Men & Women of Faith November 2014 Sheri Dew
item.description: Sister Sheri L. Dew shared key events in the life of President Ezra Taft Benson that prepared him for the challenges and opportunities he would experience later in his life. Learn more about Church History presentations.

item.title: Men & Women of Faith September 2014 Justin Bray and Reid Neilson
item.description: Justin R. Bray and Reid L. Neilson present about Assistant Church Historian Andrew Jenson's Latin America Expedition in 1923. Learn more about Church History presentations.

item.title: Men & Women of Faith August 2014 Daniel Berghout
item.description: Alexander Schreiner, one of the most celebrated organists of the 20th century, presided at the Tabernacle organ for more than 50 years. He was an inspiration to generations of organists and had a profound influence on music in the Church. Learn more about Church History presentations.

item.title: Men & Women of Faith July 2014 Brandon Metcalf
item.description: Metcalf discusses that blessings were found in the battalion members’ trials. “The pay received by the battalion from the U.S. government helped finance the move west, and Brigham Young stated that they were the ‘temporal salvation’ of the Church." Learn more about Church History presentations.

item.title: Men & Women of Faith June 2014 Chad Orton
item.description: This lecture looks at some of the experiences George Q. Cannon had as a missionary in the Hawaiian Mission that set the groundwork for the rest of his life, including service as a counselor to four Presidents of the Church. Learn more about Church History presentations.

item.title: Men & Women of Faith April 2014 Audrey Godfrey
item.description: Audrey Godfrey highlights faithful moments in Mary Fielding Smith’s lifetime that exemplify living the gospel and finding happiness. Learn more about Church History presentations.

item.title: Men & Women of Faith February 2014 Bruce C. Hafen
item.description: Elder Bruce C. Hafen presents about his experiences as he wrote 'A Disciple's Life,' the biography of Neal A. Maxwell. Learn more about Church History presentations.

item.title: Men & Women of Faith May 2014 Sherilyn Farnes
item.description: This lecture highlights faithful moments in Eliza Maria Partridge Lyman’s life that exemplify enduring through challenges and finding solace in God. Learn more about Church History presentations.

item.title: May 2014 Evening at the Museum - Bruce C. Hafen
item.description: Elder Bruce C. Hafen shares stories and insights about President Brigham Young and President Wilford Woodruff, who played key roles in the early history of the St. George temple. Learn more about Church History presentations.

item.title: Till We All Come in the Unity of the Faith
item.description: The Gospel and the Church bring God's children together in unity. Read the full essay on history.lds.org.

item.title: Seeing as We Are Seen
item.description: We can see each other first as children of God and only secondarily according the categories of men. Read the full essay on history.lds.org.

item.title: Partial Tree Strategy: Using Landscape View
item.description: This video demonstrates how to use record hints on FamilySearch.org to find family names.

item.description: Best practices for before, during, and after the seminary learning assessment. Handout is available here.

category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Best Practices for Learning Assessments
item.description: Best practices for before, during, and after the seminary learning assessment. Handout is available here.

item.title: The Power of the Gospel in Your Pocket
item.description: With more gospel resources available in digital formats, we can seek inspiration, share the gospel, and prepare for Sunday quorums and classes on our electronic devices - anytime, anywhere.

item.title: Now Serving
item.description: Each day is full of small chances to do a little good.

item.title: Free Forever, to Act for Themselves
item.description: Elder D. Todd Christofferson explains how the real manifestation of Gods love is His commandments and our agency.

item.title: More Diligent and Concerned at Home
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar suggests three ways each of us can become more diligent and concerned at home.

item.title: One Key to a Happy Family
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches that forgiveness is one of our best hopes for a happy family.

item.title: Willing to Change
item.description: God helps us change when we pray to Him with a humble heart.

item.title: Be Kind
item.description: Being kind helps set a good example in the community.

item.title: Crazy, Loud Lovely
item.description: We want our children to be successful, and Heavenly Father wants the same for all of us as His children.

item.title: When Life Gets Tough
item.description: When life gets tough, prayer can help us know what to do.

item.title: Mission Call
item.description: The call to serve can bring joy and happiness.

item.title: He Understands
item.description: Christ understands what were going through - even at our lowest moments.

item.title: He Loves Us
item.description: God loves and helps our families.

item.title: Saving Soles
item.description: Holding to the principles of the gospel can make us better in every way.

item.title: Quality Time
item.description: Be close to the ones you love to stay close to the ones you love.

item.title: Fashion Faith
item.description: Working together in a marriage helps us achieve our potential.

item.title: Families Sacrifice, Give Love
item.description: “I believe families are there to help each other.

item.title: Missing Mom
item.description: The death of a loved one can be hard. Faith in Christ can ease that pain.

item.title: Work, Part of the Plan
item.description: The principle of work is an important part of Heavenly Fathers plan for us.

item.title: Even If
item.description: Reaching our potential requires working together as a couple.

item.title: #SHAREGOODNESS
item.description: What we share reflects who we are. Are you sharing His goodness?

item.title: Blessing of Creativity
item.description: Sharing creativity can give us an appreciation of our Creator.

item.title: Learning Appreciation
item.description: Doing good things for others helps us understand Heavenly Father better.

item.title: Divine Potential
item.description: Becoming like Heavenly Father requires overcoming difficult times.

item.title: Here to Love
item.description: Heavenly Father put us on earth to serve and love each other.

item.title: Challenges Strengthen Us
item.description: Our challenges strengthen us and teach us how to act.

item.title: Blessed With Great Joy
item.description: Taking care of a loved one can bring great blessings of joy.

item.title: Because He Served
item.description: Seeing what Jesus did helps us know what to do.

item.title: See and Recognize
item.description: Were all children of God. This knowledge can help us be kind.

item.title: Hes On My Side
item.description: Knowing God wants us to succeeds can give us courage.

item.title: Happily Ever After (So Far)
item.description: Happyily ever after can get a good start at the temple.

item.title: There to Help
item.description: We learn how to sacrifice, give and love through families.

item.title: What Helps Me Overcome Challenges?
item.description: Daily challenges and stress can be overcome with the help of faith and prayer.

item.title: Focus to Remember
item.description: When we focus our lives on the Savior, we remember who we really are.

item.title: After Work
item.description: I believe its important to spend time with my children.

item.title: Honesty, Trust, Integrity
item.description: We earn the trust of others by being honest.

item.title: Partial Tree Strategy: Using Landscape View
item.description: This video demonstrates how to use record hints on FamilySearch.org to find family names.
